title: Israeli Minister Says Starving Millions In Gaza Is "Justified And Moral"
content: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich's suggestion that starving millions to death in Gaza was "justified and moral" has sparked global outrage. His comments, made during a speech last week, have been widely condemned by global powers.
summary: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich's suggestion that starving millions to death in Gaza was "justified and moral" has sparked global outrage. His comments, made during a speech last week, have been widely condemned by global powers.

title: How Rise In Ocean Temperatures Is Threatening Marine Life
content: Since April, the world has seen record high ocean temperatures and that's bad news for the plants and animals that call the ocean home.
summary: Since April, the world has seen record high ocean temperatures and that's bad news for the plants and animals that call the ocean home.

title: What Taylor Swift Fans Said After Foiled ISIS Attack On Vienna Concerts
content: Taylor Swift fans turned to social media on Thursday, grappling with sorrow, anger, and disbelief after the singer's three Vienna concerts were abruptly cancelled following the Austrian government's confirmation of a planned attack at the venue.
summary: Taylor Swift fans turned to social media on Thursday, grappling with sorrow, anger, and disbelief after the singer's three Vienna concerts were abruptly cancelled following the Austrian government's confirmation of a planned attack at the venue.

title: Live Updates: Muhammad Yunus Set To Take Oath As Bangladesh Leader
content: Nobel Peace Prize winner Muhammad Yunus will today take oath as the leader of the interim Bangladesh government. After landing in the country, Yunus paid tribute to those killed in Bangladesh's deadly protests that toppled Sheikh Hasina's government.
summary: Nobel Peace Prize winner Muhammad Yunus will today take oath as the leader of the interim Bangladesh government. After landing in the country, Yunus paid tribute to those killed in Bangladesh's deadly protests that toppled Sheikh Hasina's government.

title: Miss South Africa Contestant Pulls Out Of Final After Citizenship Row
content: Chidimma Adetshina, a law student, has been the subject of vicious, xenophobic attacks on social media since she was announced as a finalist in July.
summary: Chidimma Adetshina, a law student, has been the subject of vicious, xenophobic attacks on social media since she was announced as a finalist in July.

title: Explosives, Knives, Teen Suspects: Inside Taylor Swift Concert Attack Plot
content: The suspect had recently changed his appearance and had been consuming and sharing Islamist propaganda online, security officials said, adding that he had pledged allegiance to Islamic State but also held sympathies for Al Qaeda.
summary: The suspect had recently changed his appearance and had been consuming and sharing Islamist propaganda online, security officials said, adding that he had pledged allegiance to Islamic State but also held sympathies for Al Qaeda.

title: How A Chinese Scholar Ran A Spy Ring In US For Decades Before Arrest
content: A Chinese-American scholar, who projected himself as a pro-democracy activist, has been convicted by a US court of using his reputation to gather information on dissidents and sharing it with the Chinese government.
summary: A Chinese-American scholar, who projected himself as a pro-democracy activist, has been convicted by a US court of using his reputation to gather information on dissidents and sharing it with the Chinese government.

title: Russia Seeks 15 Years For US-Russian Ballerina Over Pro-Ukraine Donation
content: Russian prosecutors have requested a 15-year prison sentence for a dual US-Russian national charged with "treason" for making a donation to a pro-Ukraine organisation.
summary: Russian prosecutors have requested a 15-year prison sentence for a dual US-Russian national charged with "treason" for making a donation to a pro-Ukraine organisation.

title: Israel Made Costly "Strategic Mistake" By Killing Hamas Chief: Iran
content: Israel committed a costly "strategic mistake" with its killing of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran last week, Iran's acting foreign minister told AFP in an interview on Thursday.
summary: Israel committed a costly "strategic mistake" with its killing of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran last week, Iran's acting foreign minister told AFP in an interview on Thursday.

title: China Demands Probe Into US Anti-Doping Agency, Alleges Double Standard
content: China's anti-doping agency on Thursday called for an independent probe into its US counterpart after a media investigation found that American authorities allowed athletes who failed drug tests to continue to compete.
summary: China's anti-doping agency on Thursday called for an independent probe into its US counterpart after a media investigation found that American authorities allowed athletes who failed drug tests to continue to compete.

title: "Increasingly Likely" 2024 Could Be Hottest On Record: EU Climate Monitor
content: It is "increasingly likely" 2024 will be the hottest year on record, despite July ending a 13-month streak of monthly temperature records, the EU's climate monitor said Thursday.
summary: It is "increasingly likely" 2024 will be the hottest year on record, despite July ending a 13-month streak of monthly temperature records, the EU's climate monitor said Thursday.

title: Harvest Begins Early In Italy's Drought-Hit Vineyard With 35% Less Rainfall
content: The prestigious Donnafugata vineyards, which span the Italian island from the slopes of Marsala to the mantle of Mount Etna, began their harvest on July 22, an unprecedented two weeks early.
summary: The prestigious Donnafugata vineyards, which span the Italian island from the slopes of Marsala to the mantle of Mount Etna, began their harvest on July 22, an unprecedented two weeks early.

title: Teen ISIS Supporter Arrested For Planning Attack At Taylor Swift Concert
content: A 19-year-old IS sympathiser arrested in Austria was planning a suicide attack at a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna designed to kill many people, the intelligence agency said on Thursday.
summary: A 19-year-old IS sympathiser arrested in Austria was planning a suicide attack at a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna designed to kill many people, the intelligence agency said on Thursday.

title: Bangladesh's Future Clouded With Uncertainity: 4 Possible Scenarios

title: "False": Paraguayan Swimmer On Being "Kicked Out" Of Athlete's Village

title: "It's Good She's Gone, But...": Indian-American Lawmaker On Sheikh Hasina
content: Indian-American Congressman Ro Khanna today said former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's ouster from her country was "good" but the "violence now targeting Hindus was wrong".
summary: Indian-American Congressman Ro Khanna today said former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's ouster from her country was "good" but the "violence now targeting Hindus was wrong".

title: What Are Ex Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's Plans? India Says...
content: There is no update, yet, on Sheikh Hasina's future plans, the External Affairs Ministry said Thursday, days after the ousted Bangladeshi leader fled her country amid violent protests against her rule.
summary: There is no update, yet, on Sheikh Hasina's future plans, the External Affairs Ministry said Thursday, days after the ousted Bangladeshi leader fled her country amid violent protests against her rule.

title: Was Paraguay Swimmer Asked To Leave Olympic Village For Being "Too Pretty"?
content: Paraguayan swimmer Luana Alonso has found herself at the centre of a controversy at the ongoing Paris Olympics. The 20-year-old failed to advance from the women's 100m butterfly heats on July 27.
summary: Paraguayan swimmer Luana Alonso has found herself at the centre of a controversy at the ongoing Paris Olympics. The 20-year-old failed to advance from the women's 100m butterfly heats on July 27.

title: British Crocodile Expert Jailed For Raping, Torturing And Killing Dogs
content: Britton crimes involved the torture and exploitation of 42 dogs, resulting in the deaths of 39, which he recorded inside a shipping container on his property.

title: How The Kamala Harris Surge Has Scrambled Trump's Battle Plan
content: A little over two weeks ago, Donald Trump's presidential campaign had visions of an expansive national strategy that would result in a landslide victory in November.
